file_content.text: Agent Galen uncovered some disturbing information. Let's hear what he has to say.
Master Kiwiiks and I must speak with the Supreme Chancellor. I need you here, finding those design files.
I won't let you down.
I'm honored, Master.
Why me?
I have my battle, and you have yours.
Anything is better than talking to politicians.
That suits me fine.
A Jedi after my own heart.
You stay as well, Kira. Your security expertise may come in handy.
General, we have a lead on the thieves.
This is Agent Galen with the Strategic Information Service. Agent, these young Jedi will assist you.
Thirty-two hours ago, thieves raided a military storehouse. They stole weapons, supplies and data files for the Planet Prison project.
The thieves' leader slipped up--showed his face to a security camera. We identified him from our criminal database.
Vistis, Rodian smuggler, staying with the so-called Migrant Merchants' Guild. Nasty bunch of criminals.
Why would alien gangsters rob a military storehouse?
It's time I had a talk with this guild.
I'll find out.
No one "talks" to those cutthroats.
They must know what you're working on.
This is no coincidence.
Impossible. It must be a coincidence.
They'll hand over everything they stole, or else.
It doesn't matter.
We don't want to start a gang war, but I doubt we can avoid using force.
The guild is a violent, well-armed criminal cartel. Invading their headquarters is something only a Jedi could pull off.
Oh, dear. I really must go sit down. Excuse me....
Agent, let's use your fancy security network to distract those gangsters. Give my friend and the thief some quality time.
When you find Vistis, contact me. The data files are top priority, but try to recover anything else that was stolen from us. Good luck.
Glad to see you in one piece. Heard there was some trouble getting to Coruscant.
I'll fill you in later. What's the situation here?
Bring me up to speed, Master.
An Imperial battle cruiser attacked my shuttle.
It was the Empire.
You see, Orgus? The Empire grows bolder by the day. This is only the beginning.
Just some Imperial soldiers and a Mandalorian. They weren't so tough.
Nothing I couldn't handle.
Thank goodness your ego wasn't damaged.
You remember Master Kiwiiks and Padawan Kira. This is General Var Suthra and Doctor Eli Tarnis.
We're discussing why the Republic secretly built a planetary-scale weapon without consulting the Jedi.
My work barely qualifies as a weapon. It's the most humane military technology ever invented.
With a single activation, the Planet Prison super-charges a world's upper atmosphere, turning it into an enormous ion cannon.
Any starship entering or leaving the planet will be completely disabled. Perfect enemy containment, without casualties.
Have you tested this Planet Prison's safety?
A bold claim, doctor.
We were about to begin field testing when this pointless debate started.
Sounds quite promising.
The Jedi of all people should appreciate what we've created. It's a non-violent means of ending war.
You can't "contain" an enemy without casualties.
That's unlikely.
How many lives are lost during a full-scale invasion? Our new weapon will end war as we know it.
Regardless, you've allowed the Planet Prison's design files to be stolen by common criminals.
I doubt the thieves even realize what they have. Besides, the data is encrypted.
Our people are pursuing every possible lead.
With all due respect, old friend, don't you think it's time the Jedi got involved?
You'll have to excuse me. I'm here on Jedi business.
